Leaderboard API¶

This page documents the public API for the admet.leaderboard package.

The following sections document the modules that make up the leaderboard utilities. Use the module-level pages below for detailed API docs.

Configuration¶

Configuration for leaderboard scraping and analysis.

class admet.leaderboard.config.LeaderboardConfig(space='openadmet/OpenADMET-ExpansionRx-Challenge', target_user='aglisman', cache_dir=<factory>, endpoints=<factory>)[source]

Bases: object

Configuration for leaderboard scraping and analysis.

Parameters:

  • space (str)

  • target_user (str)

  • cache_dir (Path)

  • endpoints (List[str])

space

HuggingFace Space identifier (format: “owner/space-name”)

Type:

str

target_user

Username to analyze in leaderboards (case-insensitive)

Type:

str

cache_dir

Directory for caching leaderboard data and outputs

Type:

Path

endpoints

List of task endpoint names to analyze

Type:

List[str]

property all_endpoints: List[str]

Return all endpoints including ‘Average’ for overall rankings.

Returns:

[‘Average’] + endpoints list

Return type:

List[str]

cache_dir: Path
endpoints: List[str]
get_output_dir(timestamp=None)[source]

Get timestamped output directory for results.

Parameters:

timestamp (str, optional) – Timestamp string (e.g., “2025-12-16”). If None, no subdirectory.

Returns:

Output directory path

Return type:

Path

space: str = 'openadmet/OpenADMET-ExpansionRx-Challenge'
target_user: str = 'aglisman'

Client¶

Client for fetching leaderboard data from Gradio HuggingFace Spaces.

class admet.leaderboard.client.LeaderboardClient(config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Client for scraping leaderboard data from Gradio-based HuggingFace Spaces.

Parameters:

config (LeaderboardConfig) – Configuration for space and endpoints

config¶

Configuration object

Type:

LeaderboardConfig

client¶

Gradio client instance (initialized on first use)

Type:

Optional[Client]

Examples

>>> config = LeaderboardConfig(space="openadmet/OpenADMET-ExpansionRx-Challenge")
>>> client = LeaderboardClient(config)
>>> tables = client.fetch_all_tables()
>>> tables["Average"].head()
close()[source]¶

Close the Gradio client connection.

Return type:

None

fetch_all_tables(max_retries=3, retry_delay=2.0)[source]¶

Fetch all leaderboard tables from the Gradio Space.

Parameters:

  • max_retries (int, default=3) – Maximum number of retry attempts on failure

  • retry_delay (float, default=2.0) – Delay in seconds between retries

Returns:

Dictionary mapping endpoint names to DataFrames. Keys include “Average” and all configured endpoints.

Return type:

Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]

Raises:

RuntimeError – If fetching fails after all retries

Examples

>>> client = LeaderboardClient(config)
>>> tables = client.fetch_all_tables()
>>> print(tables.keys())
dict_keys(['Average', 'LogD', 'KSOL', ...])

Parser¶

Parser utilities for leaderboard data.

admet.leaderboard.parser.extract_value_uncertainty(val)[source]¶

Parse strings like ‘0.35 +/- 0.01’ or ‘0.35 ± 0.01’.

Extracts mean value and uncertainty from formatted strings.

Parameters:

val (Any) – Value to parse (typically str)

Returns:

(value, uncertainty). Returns (None, None) if parsing fails.

Return type:

Tuple[Optional[float], Optional[float]]

Examples

>>> extract_value_uncertainty("0.35 +/- 0.01")
(0.35, 0.01)
>>> extract_value_uncertainty("0.42 ± 0.02")
(0.42, 0.02)
>>> extract_value_uncertainty("invalid")
(None, None)
admet.leaderboard.parser.find_user_rank(df, target_user)[source]¶

Return 1-based row rank for target_user based on displayed row order.

Matches both plain usernames (e.g., ‘aglisman’) and markdown links (e.g., ‘[aglisman](https://…)’). Matching is case-insensitive.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – Leaderboard DataFrame with a ‘user’ column

  • target_user (str) – Username to find (case-insensitive)

Returns:

1-based rank (row index + 1), or None if not found

Return type:

Optional[int]

Examples

>>> df = pd.DataFrame({"user": ["alice", "bob", "charlie"]})
>>> find_user_rank(df, "bob")
2
>>> find_user_rank(df, "BOB")
2
>>> find_user_rank(df, "dave")
None
admet.leaderboard.parser.normalize_user_cell(x)[source]¶

Normalize user cell text for case-insensitive matching.

Converts to lowercase and strips whitespace.

Parameters:

x (Any) – User cell value (typically str or None)

Returns:

Normalized lowercase string, empty if None

Return type:

str

Examples

>>> normalize_user_cell("  Alice  ")
'alice'
>>> normalize_user_cell(None)
''
admet.leaderboard.parser.to_dataframe(gradio_value)[source]¶

Convert common Gradio table payload formats into a pandas DataFrame.

Handles multiple Gradio output formats: - {“headers”: […], “data”: [[…], …]} - {“columns”: […], “data”: [[…], …]} - {“data”: [[…], …]} (headers inferred as col0, col1, …) - [[…], …] (list of rows, headers inferred) - pandas DataFrame (returned as-is)

Parameters:

gradio_value (Any) – Gradio table output value

Returns:

Parsed DataFrame. Returns empty DataFrame if parsing fails.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Examples

>>> data = {"headers": ["rank", "user"], "data": [[1, "alice"], [2, "bob"]]}
>>> df = to_dataframe(data)
>>> df.columns.tolist()
['rank', 'user']

Report¶

Report generation for leaderboard results.

class admet.leaderboard.report.ResultsData(summary_df, tables, task_mins, overall_min, target_user, timestamp)[source]

Bases: object

Structured container for leaderboard analysis results.

Parameters:

  • summary_df (DataFrame)

  • tables (Dict[str, DataFrame])

  • task_mins (Dict[str, float])

  • overall_min (float | None)

  • target_user (str)

  • timestamp (str)

summary_df

Summary DataFrame with columns: task, rank, n_rows, mae, r2, spearman, kendall

Type:

pd.DataFrame

tables

Raw leaderboard tables by endpoint name

Type:

Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]

task_mins

Minimum MAE value for each task (from rank #1)

Type:

Dict[str, float]

overall_min

Minimum MA-RAE from overall leaderboard rank #1

Type:

Optional[float]

target_user

Username being analyzed

Type:

str

timestamp

ISO format timestamp of analysis

Type:

str

overall_min: Optional[float]
summary_df: DataFrame
tables: Dict[str, DataFrame]
target_user: str
task_mins: Dict[str, float]
timestamp: str
admet.leaderboard.report.generate_markdown_report(results, output_path, include_figures=True)[source]

Generate comprehensive markdown report matching SUBMISSIONS.md format.

Parameters:

  • results (ResultsData) – Structured results data

  • output_path (Path) – Output file path for the markdown report

  • include_figures (bool, default=True) – Whether to include figure links in the report

Return type:

None

Examples

>>> results = ResultsData(...)
>>> generate_markdown_report(results, Path("report.md"))
admet.leaderboard.report.save_csv_data(results, output_dir)[source]

Save leaderboard tables to CSV files.

Creates CSV files for each endpoint in the output directory.

Parameters:

  • results (ResultsData) – Structured results data

  • output_dir (Path) – Output directory for CSV files

Return type:

None

Examples

>>> results = ResultsData(...)
>>> save_csv_data(results, Path("output/csv"))
admet.leaderboard.report.save_summary_statistics(results, output_path)[source]

Save summary statistics to a text file.

Parameters:

  • results (ResultsData) – Structured results data

  • output_path (Path) – Output file path for summary statistics

Return type:

None

Examples

>>> results = ResultsData(...)
>>> save_summary_statistics(results, Path("summary.txt"))

Plots¶

Leaderboard visualization functions.

This module provides publication-quality plotting functions for leaderboard analysis, including rankings, performance comparisons, and diagnostic visualizations.

admet.plot.leaderboard.generate_all_plots(results_df, tables, task_mins, overall_min, output_dir, target_user)[source]¶

Generate all leaderboard plots.

Parameters:

  • results_df (pd.DataFrame) – Summary results DataFrame

  • tables (Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]) – Raw leaderboard tables

  • task_mins (Dict[str, float]) – Minimum MAE per task

  • overall_min (Optional[float]) – Minimum overall MA-RAE

  • output_dir (Path) – Output directory for plots

  • target_user (str) – Target username

Return type:

None

admet.plot.leaderboard.plot_delta_mae_comparison(task_data, task_mins, target_user, *, figsize=(12, 8))[source]¶

Plot performance gap analysis (delta MAE to minimum).

Parameters:

  • task_data (pd.DataFrame) – Task data with ‘task’ and ‘mae’ columns

  • task_mins (Dict[str, float]) – Minimum MAE values per task

  • target_user (str) – Username for title

  • figsize (Tuple[float, float], default=(12, 8)) – Figure size

Returns:

Figure and axes

Return type:

Tuple[Figure, Axes]

admet.plot.leaderboard.plot_mae_comparison_bar(task_data, task_mins, target_user, *, figsize=(12, 8))[source]¶

Plot MAE values comparison with minimum (top performer).

Parameters:

  • task_data (pd.DataFrame) – Task data with ‘task’ and ‘mae’ columns

  • task_mins (Dict[str, float]) – Minimum MAE values per task

  • target_user (str) – Username for title

  • figsize (Tuple[float, float], default=(12, 8)) – Figure size

Returns:

Figure and axes

Return type:

Tuple[Figure, Axes]

admet.plot.leaderboard.plot_metrics_heatmap(task_data, *, figsize=(14, 10))[source]¶

Plot multi-metric heatmaps for each task.

Parameters:

  • task_data (pd.DataFrame) – Task data with metric columns

  • figsize (Tuple[float, float], default=(14, 10)) – Figure size

Returns:

Figure and axes array

Return type:

Tuple[Figure, np.ndarray]

admet.plot.leaderboard.plot_overall_rank_distribution(df_overall, user_rank=None, *, figsize=(14, 6))[source]¶

Plot overall ranking distribution with histogram and ECDF.

Parameters:

  • df_overall (pd.DataFrame) – Overall leaderboard DataFrame with ‘rank’ column

  • user_rank (Optional[int]) – User’s rank to highlight

  • figsize (Tuple[float, float], default=(14, 6)) – Figure size

Returns:

Figure and axes array

Return type:

Tuple[Figure, np.ndarray]

admet.plot.leaderboard.plot_performance_category_pie(task_data, *, figsize=(10, 7))[source]¶

Plot performance distribution pie chart.

  • task_data (pd.DataFrame) – Task data with ‘rank’ column

  • figsize (Tuple[float, float], default=(10, 7)) – Figure size

Returns:

Figure and axes

Return type:

Tuple[Figure, Axes]

Plot rank vs metric scatter plot.

Parameters:

  • task_data (pd.DataFrame) – Task data

  • metric (str) – Metric column name

  • metric_label (str) – Metric label for axis

  • figsize (Tuple[float, float], default=(10, 6)) – Figure size

Returns:

Figure and axes

Return type:

Tuple[Figure, Axes]

admet.plot.leaderboard.plot_task_rankings_bar(task_data, target_user, *, figsize=(12, 8))[source]¶

Plot task-specific rankings as horizontal bar chart with performance zones.

Parameters:

  • task_data (pd.DataFrame) – Task data with ‘task’ and ‘rank’ columns

  • target_user (str) – Username for title

  • figsize (Tuple[float, float], default=(12, 8)) – Figure size

Returns:

Figure and axes

Return type:

Tuple[Figure, Axes]

admet.plot.leaderboard.save_figure_formats(fig, output_path, formats=['png', 'svg', 'pdf'])[source]¶

Save figure in multiple formats.

Parameters:

  • fig (Figure) – Matplotlib figure to save

  • output_path (Path) – Base output path (without extension)

  • formats (List[str], default=["png", "svg", "pdf"]) – File formats to save

Return type:

None
